meanings.definition: Fill (someone) with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially to do something creative.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's words of encouragement can inspire students to work hard.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork always inspires me to be more creative.
meanings.sent3: Watching a motivational video can inspire you to clean your room with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset inspired a sense of peace within her.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk was so inspiring that the team won the game.

meanings.sent1: After running, she took a deep breath to inspire more oxygen into her lungs.
meanings.sent2: The doctor instructed the patient to inspire deeply before blowing out the candles.
meanings.sent3: Trying to inspire too much air at once can make you dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The fresh mountain air inspired a sense of rejuvenation in her.
meanings.sent5: Inhale deeply to inspire the scent of the flowers.

meanings.definition: Create (a feeling, especially a positive one) in a person.
meanings.sent1: His kind words never fail to inspire happiness in others.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party inspired joy in her heart.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie inspired laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The thoughtful gesture inspired gratitude in her friends.
meanings.sent5: The music inspired a sense of nostalgia in the listeners.
